summary: My little homelab is bit different from many others in that I don't have a SAN/NAS or other dedicated storage setup.  This can sometimes make sharing files between systems a little bit tricky.  I've used workarounds like Tailscale Serve for sharing files over HTTP or simply scping files around as needed, but none of those solutions are really very elegant...

I recently shared how I set up Packer to build Proxmox templates in my homelab.  That post covered storing (and retrieving) environment-specific values in Vault, the cloud-init configuration for defining the installation parameters, the various post-install scripts for further customizing and hardening the template, and the Packer template files that tie it all together.
